meanings.definition: The quality or state of being intolerable.
meanings.sent1: The intolerability of the loud noise made it impossible to concentrate.
meanings.sent2: The intolerability of the pain forced her to seek medical help.
meanings.sent3: The intolerability of the situation was so extreme that it almost seemed comical.
meanings.sent4: The intolerability of the heat was like standing in a blazing furnace.
meanings.sent5: The intolerability of the smell was so overpowering that it lingered for days.

meanings.definition: The inability to endure or withstand.
meanings.sent1: His intolerability towards spicy food made dining out a challenge.
meanings.sent2: The intolerability of the cold weather made her shiver uncontrollably.
meanings.sent3: His intolerability towards early mornings often led to comical situations.
meanings.sent4: The intolerability of the workload felt like carrying a mountain on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The intolerability of the noise was like a constant hammering in his ears.
